title: attach-a-payment-plan-to-a-payment

The *Create Payment* button is not enabled on all accounts by default. If you would like to enable this feature, please contact your relationship manager. 
Once you have created a payment plan using the form on the *Payment Plan Screen*, you can then attach it to a new card payment to create a subscription. To create a card payment, navigate to the transactions screen and click *Create Payment*. Fill out the required fields (denoted in red).  
Upload an image...
hub-create-payment-with-plan.png
change·remove

Don't have one handy? Use our logo to start!

To attach a payment plan to the payment, tick the *Attach payment plan* checkbox. This will reveal the fields listed below. Once you have completed the form, click *Save* to create the payment and apply the attached Payment Plan.  
x    
Add Row Add Col
Payment Plan <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
Dropdown menu of all your active Payment Plans. 
Optional Start Date <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Date of the first recurring payment. If left blank, the date of the first recurring payment will be equal to the current date plus the frequency. For example, if the current date is 01-01-2018 and the frequency is *Monthly*, the start date of the plan will be 01-02-2018 if Optional Start Date is left blank. 
Please note that the details of this initial card payment (e.g., value, currency, track ID) do not have to match the details of the Payment Plan. For instance, you can create a charge of £10 and attach a Payment Plan with a £20 recurring payment. 
If you open the charge summary view from the Transaction Screen, you will note that the Transaction Indicator is set to *Recurring*, which indicates that it is related to a payment plan.  
Upload an image...
hub-pp-charge-summary.png
change·remove

Don't have one handy? Use our logo to start!

 
If you open the customer view from the Customers Screen, you will see a summary of the Payment Plan towards the bottom section of the window (click the blue down arrow to expand). 
Upload an image...
hub-pp-customer-charge.png
change·remove

Don't have one handy? Use our logo to start!

You'll also notice three options: Suspend, Edit and Delete. * **Suspend**: Cancels all scheduled recurring payments belonging to the plan. Note that this only suspends the plan for the single customer, not all customers subscribed to the plan. Click Enable to take the plan out of suspension. * **Edit**: Allows you to select a different customer card to charge the recurring payments. Click Save to save your changes. * **Delete**: Removes the payment plan from the customer. Click Delete, then click Yes to confirm. ## Example: Creating a $50 USD Monthly Subscription lasting 1 Year Assume Merchant ABC wants to subscribe new customers to a $50 USD monthly payment plan called Monthly Subscription. The subscription is intended to last 1 year (12 months) in total. <span style="color: #5476fb; font-size: 20px;">Step 1:</span> **Create Payment Plan** The first step is to create a payment plan, which can be done from the Payment Plan screen as follows: 
The Plan Duration has been set to 11 months. This is due to the fact that the initial payment will be created using the Create Payment form in the Transactions screen (Step 2). 
 
Upload an image...
create-plan-example.png
change·remove

Don't have one handy? Use our logo to start!

<span style="color: #5476fb; font-size: 20px;">Step 2:</span> **Create initial payment and attach payment plan** Once *Monthly Subscription* has been successfully created (Step 1), it is ready to be attached to a customer payment to form a subscription. To do this, navigate to the Transaction screen and click *Create Payment*. For the purposes of this example, assume the current date is 10-09-2016. Below is an example of a complete Create Payment form. 
Upload an image...
create-payment-with-plan.png
change·remove

Note that the **Optional Start Date** of the payment plan has been set to 15-10-2016. This creates the following subscription schedule:
